Class CommandExecutor

java.lang.Object
cat.dam.roig.cleanstream.util.CommandExecutor
public class CommandExecutor extends Object
Utility class responsible for:
  • Executing external system commands (e.g. yt-dlp)
  • Streaming process output line-by-line in real time
  • Appending quality-related arguments to yt-dlp commands

This class centralizes all low-level process execution logic so that controllers (e.g. DownloadExecutionController) remain clean and focused on UI behavior.

Important: This class does NOT manage threads. It should be executed from a background thread (e.g. SwingWorker) to avoid blocking the EDT.

Author:
metku

  • Method Details

    • runStreaming

      public static int runStreaming(List<String> command, Consumer<String> onLine) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Executes a system command and streams its output line-by-line.

      This is a simplified overload that does not expose the underlying Process instance.

      Parameters:
      command - full command including arguments
      onLine - consumer invoked for each output line
      Returns:
      process exit code
      Throws:
      IOException - if process cannot be started
      InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted

    • runStreaming

      public static int runStreaming(List<String> command, Consumer<String> onLine, Consumer<Process> onProcessStart) throws IOException, InterruptedException
      Executes a system command and streams its combined output (stdout + stderr) line-by-line.

      Features:

      • Merges stderr into stdout (redirectErrorStream(true))
      • Streams output in real time
      • Optionally exposes the Process instance (useful for Stop button)

      Parameters:
      command - full command including arguments
      onLine - consumer invoked for each output line (must not be null)
      onProcessStart - optional consumer invoked once process starts
      Returns:
      process exit code
      Throws:
      IOException - if process cannot be started
      InterruptedException - if the current thread is interrupted

    • appendQualityArgs

      public static void appendQualityArgs(List<String> cmd, VideoQuality q)
      Appends yt-dlp quality selection arguments to the provided command list.

      This method modifies the given cmd list by adding:

      • -f format selector
      • merge format settings

      Behavior:

      • P1080 → best video ≤ 1080p + best audio
      • P720 → best video ≤ 720p + best audio
      • P480 → best video ≤ 480p + best audio
      • BEST_AVAILABLE → best available

      Final container is always forced to MP4 using --merge-output-format mp4.

      Parameters:
      cmd - command list to modify
      q - selected video quality
